thread.title: The Joker roller coaster introduces a little anarchy to Six Flags (VIDEO)
thread.title_full: The Joker roller coaster introduces a little anarchy to Six Flags (VIDEO)

title: The Joker roller coaster introduces a little anarchy to Six Flags (VIDEO)
text:
The Joker roller coaster introduces a little anarchy to Six Flags (VIDEO) Friday September 4, 2015 
LOS ANGELES, Sept 4 — The Joker is coming to Six Flags Discovery Kingdom. 
Or a roller coaster inspired by his signature purple and green colours is anyway. 
The theme park revealed yesterday that it will be launching the new thrill ride inspired by Batman’s arch-nemesis in early 2016. 
This will be the second DC Comics-themed ride at Six Flags. The first, Superman Ultimate Flight, made its debut in 2012. 
Six Flags Discover Kingdom will launch the green and purple ride in early 2016. — Screen grab from YouTube In a press release, park president Don McCoy said, “The Joker will be the most talked about new coaster in 2016. We are excited to introduce this innovative technology that marries the best of both classic and modern coaster designs to offer our guests an unparalleled and unique experience.” 
As such, the wood-and-steel ride will take after the Joker’s unpredictable personality: it will have 3,200 feet of purple and green track, as well as chaotic twists and turns involving a Zero G barrel roll, three inversions, 15 airtime moments and a “fake-out” with a unique “breaking-wave turn.” 
The highlight will be the first-ever "step-up, under-flip inverted roll" that takes riders horizontal. 
The Joker roller coaster will reportedly have a maximum speed of 85kmh. 
Buckle up and enjoy the ride, folks. It’s going to be a wild one. More Stories for You:
